title: K2 Brothers Brewing
imageAlt: logo with pints of beer behind
description: K2 Brothers Brewing is a NYS Farm/Micro Brewery in Penfield, NY, which opened December of 2017. It is owned and operated by brothers Kyle and Bradley Kennedy, with the support of their family and friends.

title: Fifth Frame Brewing Co.
imageAlt: a glass of beer with fifth frame brewing co printed on it
description: A Rochester NY microbrewery in downtown featuring craft beer, specialty coffee, and an open kitchen serving breakfast, lunch and dinner food.

title: Swift Water Brewing
imageAlt: bar area at Swift Water Brewing
description: We’re located on Mount Hope Ave. with indoor and outdoor space to enjoy. When visiting the taproom, you’ll see the heart of Swiftwater in every detail, and we hope you’ll enjoy our beer just as much as we love making it!

title: Genesee Brewing Co.
description: The Genesee Brewing Company, based in Rochester, New York, is one of the largest and oldest continually operating breweries in the United States. The Brewery makes the Genesee line of beers, including the iconic Genesee, the refreshing Genny Light, and The Original Cream Ale.

title: Nine Maidens Brewing Company
description: Our aim is to provide the Rochester beer scene with a range of beer styles, from trendy to historica.

title: Rohrbach Brewing Company
imageAlt: flight of full pint glasses of beer
description: Founded in 1991 by John and Patty Urlaub, Rohrbach Brewing Co. is the first craft brewery in Rochester, NY. The brewing company takes its name from Rohrbach, Germany, a small town that inspired its founder to bring craft beer to Rochester. The company first originated in the German House on Gregory Street, then grew into the two restaurant locations existing today - the brewery and beer hall in downtown Rochester on Railroad St. and the Buffalo Road Brewpub Restaurant in Gates.

title: Three Heads Brewing
imageAlt: Three Heads logo on outside of building
description: The Three Heads Brewing Beer Garden on Atlantic Avenue in Rochester is where it all goes down. You can enjoy all your 3HB favorites straight from the source.  Beer just doesn’t come any fresher than this. Come in to try our rotating seasonal craft brew offerings, rotating food truck options or to enjoy some weekly live music.  Plus we have a patio that rivals any other in the city. Three Heads Brewing….we don’t just know beer, we live it.

title: Irondequoit Beer Company
imageAlt: bar area at Irondequoit Beer Company
description: Our story begins with an old hidden treasure within the Town of Irondequoit in Upstate NY. A barn, where generations once farmed their land with grit and sweat, was sitting empty and unseen. We wanted to continue that tradition of taking Nature’s harvest and produce something that we could be proud of. So we brought this little barn back to life and we are honored to give Irondequoit their first brewery.

title: Iron Tug Brewing
imageAlt: Iron Tug Brewing logo featuring a tug boat
description: Founded in 2016, Iron Tug Brewing owes its unique name to a merchant marine turned craft brewer. ITB strives to brew an inspiring array of thoughtful, sophisticated, and supremely drinkable beers locally in Rochester, NY. Partnering with nearby farms and using only the freshest ingredients, ITB’s custom creations continue to gather a loyal following. Enjoy one if by land, two if by sea.

title: Sager-Stoneyard Pub
imageAlt: beer glasses with Sager label and filled with different shades of beer
description: Formerly known as the Sager Beer Works Taproom, we are Rochester’s first dual-brewery pub.
address: 46 Sager Dr Suite E, Rochester, NY 14607
